description: Conversion of dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) into seven-bedroom, eight-person large house in multiple occupation (HMO) (Use Class Sui Generis); associated amenity, cycle parking and waste storage spaces; and alteration to south-facing side elevation involving installation of single window opening at first floor level, and to rear elevation involving replacement of door and window opening with single window opening
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: 1816/41HMO-03/SP Rev. A; 1816/41HMO-04/SP; 1816/41HMO-05/SP; 1816/41HMO-06/SP Rev. A; 1816/41HMO-07/SP Rev. A; and 1816/41HMO-08/SP.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | The large house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than seven (7) rooms and eight (8) occupants.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4, D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | A minimum of two (2) 240.0 litre bins dedicated to recycling and two (2) 240.0 litre bins dedicated to refuse, as well as, bins providing the equivalent of ninety-two (92.0) litres of food waste storage shall be provided within the curtilage of the property in accordance with dwg. 1816/41HMO-06/SP Rev. A of Condition 2, as well as, the adopted standards of the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding public health, reducing and managing waste generated by the development, and keeping local highways clear of visual blight and impediments to movement in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of seven (7) secured cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the property in accordance with dwg. 1816/41HMO-06/SP Rev. A of Condition 2, as well as, the adopted standards of the London Plan (2021) and Council's Transport Strategy (2019). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies T1, T2, T4, and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The shower and toilet room window on the front elevation of the building at the ground floor level as shown in the plans listed in Condition 2 must be made obscured-glazed. Additionally, side-facing window to be installed onto the south-facing side elevation of the building at the first floor level as shown in the plans listed in Condition 2 must be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

REASON: To ensure the privacy of future occupants of the development and protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Enhanced sound insulation for the approved residential building shall be installed to achieve an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use of the floor / ceilings / wall structures separating bathrooms / communal entrances / stairs / kitchen / living / circulation spaces from bedrooms. The enhanced sound insulation measures shall be based on standards of Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014, implemented prior to occupation of the development, and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development is not adversely affected by noise from adjoining bathrooms and communal spaces, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The sound insulation of the building envelope (incl. glazing specifications and external amenity areas) shall be provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority's standards as stated in Ealing's Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 and achieve compliance with the acoustic criteria specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise.  The sound insulation and necessary measures must be provided/implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and, thereafter, permanently retained and maintained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from cultural and transport sources in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, works to provide the hard and soft landscaping (incl. trees, shrubs and plants) shown on dwgs. 1816/41HMO-03/SP Rev. A and 1816/41HMO-06/SP Rev. A of Condition 2 shall be carried out in full, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, and maintained permanently. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season and maintained permanently.

REASON: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area, ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, and providing sustainable urban drainage in accordance with policies D4, D5, D6, G4, G5, G7, SI1, SI12, SI13 and T2 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).
